### Recent News

The **Raptors** (32-23, 5th in Eastern Conference) recently defeated Indiana 122-104 on February 8 before losing to Detroit 95-113 on February 11.[2] **Brandon Ingram** and **Scottie Barnes** are the team's offensive anchors, averaging 19.1 and 18.7 points per game respectively, while **RJ Barrett** contributes 18 points per game.[2][4]

The **Bulls** (24-31, 11th in Eastern Conference) have struggled recently, losing consecutive games to Boston (105-115) and another opponent (115-123).[2] **Josh Giddey** leads the team with 18 points and 8 assists per game, while **Collin Sexton** and **Anfernee Simons** average 17 and 16.8 points respectively.[2]

The teams previously met on February 5, with Toronto winning 123-107.[2]

**Game Time:** 8:00 PM ET at United Center in Chicago[1][2]

### Player & Team News
# Player-Focused News Report: Raptors @ Bulls

## Player Form & Streaks

The **Raptors are riding strong momentum**, having won seven of their last 11 games and already eclipsed last season's win total.[3] **Brandon Ingram**, who averages a team-best 21.8 points per game, was selected to the All-Star Game as a replacement for Stephen Curry, underscoring his recent performance level.[3] In Toronto's 123-107 victory over Chicago on February 5, Ingram scored 33 points, demonstrating his ability to dominate against this specific opponent.[3]

For the Bulls, **Anfernee Simons** has shown immediate impact since his acquisition from the Boston Celtics, averaging 16.8 points in four games with Chicago.[3] **Matas Buzelis** has also elevated his production significantly, averaging 15.2 points this season compared to just 8.6 in 2024-25, while **Guerschon Yabusele** has contributed 10.8 points in his first four games after averaging only 2.7 with the New York Knicks.[3]

## Returning Players & Ramp-Ups

The Bulls are awaiting the return of key guards from injury. **Josh Giddey**, who last played on January 28 and leads the team with 18.6 points and 8.8 assists per game, is listed as questionable with a left hamstring injury.[3][5] **Tre Jones**, sidelined since January 22 and averaging a team-leading 1.3 steals per contest, remains unavailable.[3]

For Toronto, **Sandro Mamukelashvili** is questionable with a right rib contusion, while **Collin Murray-Boyles** is probable with a thumb injury.[5]

## Trade & Roster Buzz

The Bulls have undergone significant roster changes, acquiring **Anfernee Simons** from the Boston Celtics and **Guerschon Yabusele** from the New York Knicks.[3] These moves represent an attempt to bolster a struggling roster currently sitting 11th in the Eastern Conference at 24-31.

## Matchup Storylines

The Raptors' recent dominance over the Bulls is notable: Toronto defeated Chicago 123-107 on February 5, with Ingram's 33-point performance and Quickley's 24 points leading the way.[3] The Bulls' new acquisitions—Simons, Yabusele, and Buzelis—will face a Raptors team that has already proven it can contain them, though the Bulls' roster composition has changed since that matchup.
